A Profile for Autonomous System Provider Authorization A Profile for Autonomous System Provider Authorization
draft-ietf-sidrops-aspa-profile-12 draft-ietf-sidrops-aspa-profile-13
Abstract Abstract
This document defines a Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) protected This document defines a Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) protected
content type for Autonomous System Provider Authorization (ASPA) content type for Autonomous System Provider Authorization (ASPA)
objects for use with the Resource Public Key Infrastructure (RPKI). objects for use with the Resource Public Key Infrastructure (RPKI).
An ASPA is a digitally signed object through which the issuer (the An ASPA is a digitally signed object through which the issuer (the
holder of an Autonomous System identifier), can authorize one or more holder of an Autonomous System identifier), can authorize one or more
other Autonomous Systems (ASes) as its upstream providers. When other Autonomous Systems (ASes) as its upstream providers. When
validated, an ASPA's eContent can be used for detection and validated, an ASPA's eContent can be used for detection and

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
The primary purpose of the Resource Public Key Infrastructure (RPKI) The primary purpose of the Resource Public Key Infrastructure (RPKI)
is to improve routing security [RFC6480]. As part of this is to improve routing security [RFC6480]. As part of this
infrastructure, a mechanism is needed to facilitate holders of infrastructure, a mechanism is needed to facilitate holders of
Autonomous System (AS) identifiers in their capacity as Customer to Autonomous System (AS) identifiers in their capacity as Customer to
authorize other ASes as their Provider(s). A Provider AS (PAS) is a authorize other ASes as their Provider(s). A Provider AS (PAS) is a
network that: network that:
a. offers its customers outbound (customer to Internet) data traffic a. offers its customers outbound (customer to Internet) data traffic
connectivity and/or connectivity and/or
b. further propagates in all directions (towards providers, lateral b. further propagates in all directions (towards providers, lateral
peers, and customers) any BGP Updates that the customer may send. peers, and customers) any BGP Updates that the customer may send.
The digitally signed Autonomous System Provider Authorization (ASPA) The digitally signed Autonomous System Provider Authorization (ASPA)
object described in this document provides the above-mentioned object described in this document provides the above-mentioned
authorization mechanism. See [I-D.ietf-sidrops-aspa-verification] authorization mechanism.
for a specification how to use Validated ASPA Payloads (VAPs) to
filter BGP UPDATE messages.
An ASPA object is a cryptographically verifiable attestation signed An ASPA object is a cryptographically verifiable attestation signed
by the holder of an Autonomous System identifier (hereafter called by the holder of an Autonomous System identifier (hereafter called
the "Customer AS", or CAS). An ASPA contains lists one or more ASes, the "Customer AS", or CAS). An ASPA contains a list of one or more
each listing meaning the listed AS is authorized to act as Provider ASes, each listing meaning the listed AS is authorized to act as
network. When the CAS has multiple Providers, all Provider ASes that Provider network. When the CAS has multiple Providers, all Provider
provide service to the CAS are listed in the ASPA, including any non- ASes are listed in the ASPA, including any non-transparent Internet
transparent Internet Exchange Point (IXP) Route Server (RS) ASes. Exchange Point (IXP) Route Server (RS) ASes. The common case for RS
The common case for Route Servers (RS) at Internet Exchange Points is ASes at IXPs is to operate transparently (see Section 2.2.2.1
to operate transparently (see Section 2.2.2.1 [RFC7947]), thus [RFC7947]), and in those instances the ASNs of IXP Route Servers are
usually, the ASNs of IX Route Servers are not listed as PAS in ASPAs. not listed as PAS in ASPAs.
The ASPA content type definition conforms to the [RFC6488] template The BGP Roles that an Autonomous System (AS) may have in its peering
for RPKI signed objects. relationships with eBGP neighbors are discussed in
[I-D.ietf-sidrops-aspa-verification]. The details of ASPA
registration requirements for ASes in different scenarios are also
specified in that document. In addition, the procedures for
verifying AS_PATHs in BGP UPDATE messages using Validated ASPA
Payloads (VAPs) are described in that document.
In accordance with Section 4 of [RFC6488], this document defines: The ASPA content type definition conforms to the [RFC6488] template
for RPKI signed objects. In accordance with Section 4 of [RFC6488],
this document defines:
1. The object identifier (OID) that identifies the ASPA signed 1. The object identifier (OID) that identifies the ASPA signed
object. This OID appears in the eContentType field of the object. This OID appears in the eContentType field of the
encapContentInfo object as well as the content-type signed encapContentInfo object as well as the content-type signed
attribute within the signerInfo structure. attribute within the signerInfo structure.
2. The ASN.1 syntax for the ASPA content, which is the payload 2. The ASN.1 syntax for the ASPA content, which is the payload
signed by the CAS. The ASPA content is encoded using the ASN.1 signed by the CAS. The ASPA content is encoded using the ASN.1
[X.680] Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER) [X.690]. [X.680] Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER) [X.690].

3. ASPA eContent 3. ASPA eContent
The content of an ASPA identifies the Customer AS (CAS) as well as The content of an ASPA identifies the Customer AS (CAS) as well as
the Set of Provider ASes (SPAS) that are authorized by the CAS to be the Set of Provider ASes (SPAS) that are authorized by the CAS to be
its Providers. its Providers.
If a Customer AS is connected to multiple transit providers/non- A user registering ASPA(s) must be cognizant of Sections 2, 3, and 4
transparent route servers, all Provider ASes MUST be registered in a of [I-D.ietf-sidrops-aspa-verification] and the user (or their
single ASPA object. This rule is important to avoid possible race software tool) must comply with the ASPA registration recommendations
conditions during updates of ASPAs. in Section 4 of that document.
It is highly recommended that for a given Customer AS, a single ASPA
object be maintained which contains all providers, including any non-
transparent RS ASes. Such a practice helps prevent race conditions
during ASPA updates. Otherwise, said race conditions might affect
route propagation. The software that provides hosting for ASPA
records SHOULD support enforcement of this recommendation. In the
case of the transition process between different CA registries, the
ASPA records SHOULD be kept identical in all registries in terms of
their authorization contents.
The eContent of an ASPA is an instance of ASProviderAttestation, The eContent of an ASPA is an instance of ASProviderAttestation,
formally defined by the following ASN.1 [X.680] module: formally defined by the following ASN.1 [X.680] module:
RPKI-ASPA-2022
{ iso(1) member-body(2) us(840) rsadsi(113549) pkcs(1)
pkcs-9(9) smime(16) modules(0) id-mod-rpki-aspa-2022(TBD) }
DEFINITIONS IMPLICIT TAGS ::=
BEGIN
IMPORTS
CONTENT-TYPE
FROM CryptographicMessageSyntax-2010 -- RFC 6268
{ iso(1) member-body(2) us(840) rsadsi(113549) pkcs(1)
pkcs-9(9) smime(16) modules(0) id-mod-cms-2009(58) } ;
id-ct-ASPA OBJECT IDENTIFIER ::=
{ iso(1) member-body(2) us(840) rsadsi(113549) pkcs(1)
pkcs-9(9) id-smime(16) id-ct(1) aspa(49) }
ct-ASPA CONTENT-TYPE ::=
{ TYPE ASProviderAttestation IDENTIFIED BY id-ct-ASPA }
ASProviderAttestation ::= SEQUENCE {
version [0] INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
customerASID ASID,
providers ProviderASSet }
ProviderASSet ::= SEQUENCE (SIZE(1..MAX)) OF ProviderAS
ProviderAS ::= SEQUENCE {
providerASID ASID,
afiLimit AddressFamilyIdentifier OPTIONAL }
ASID ::= INTEGER (0..4294967295)
AddressFamilyIdentifier ::= OCTET STRING (SIZE (2))
END
Note that this content appears as the eContent within the Note that this content appears as the eContent within the
encapContentInfo as specified in [RFC6488]. encapContentInfo as specified in [RFC6488].
3.1. version 3.1. version
The version number of the ASProviderAttestation MUST be v0. The version number of the ASProviderAttestation MUST be v0.
3.2. customerASID 3.2. customerASID
The customerASID field contains the AS number of the Customer The customerASID field contains the AS number of the Customer
Autonomous System that is the authorizing entity. Autonomous System that is the authorizing entity.
3.3. providers 3.3. providers
The providers field contains the listing of ASes that are authorized The providers field contains the listing of ASes that are authorized
as providers or route servers in the specified address family. as providers.
Each element contained in the providers field is an instance of Each element contained in the providers field is an instance of
ProviderAS. ProviderAS.
In addition to the constraints described by the formal ASN.1 In addition to the constraints described by the formal ASN.1
definition, the contents of the providers field MUST satisfy the definition, the contents of the providers field MUST satisfy the
following constraints: following constraints:
* The CustomerASID value MUST NOT appear in any providerASID field. * The CustomerASID value MUST NOT appear in any providerASID field.

6. Security Considerations 6. Security Considerations
While it is not technically enforcable, it is highly recommended that The security considerations of [RFC6481], [RFC6485], and [RFC6488]
for a given Customer AS, a single ASPA object be maintained which also apply to ASPAs.
contains all providers/route servers. Administrating all providers
in a single object helps prevent race conditions during ASPA updates
that might affect prefix propagation. The software that provides
hosting for ASPA records SHOULD support enforcement of this rule. In
the case of the transition process between different CA registries,
the ASPA records SHOULD be kept identical in all registries in terms
of their authorization contents.
